Question 2 
 
 
 
 
 
  
 
Four persons P, Q, R and S are to be seated in a row, all facing the same direction, but not necessarily in 
the same order. P and R can not sit adjacent to each other. S should be seated to the right of Q. The number 
of distinct seating arrangements possible is:  
 
(A) 4 
 
(B) 2 
(C)  8  
(D)  6 
Ans. 
D 
Sol.
 
Condition 1 : 
P and R can not sit adjacent to each other. 
 
Condition 2 : 
S should be seated to the right of Q,  
 
According to this all possible cases will be 
 
1. 
Q  P  S  R 
 
2. 
Q  R  S  P 
 
3. 
P  Q  S  R 
 
4. 
R  Q  S  P 
 
5. 
P  Q  R  S 
 
6. 
R  Q  P  S 
 
Hence, the correct option is (D).
